title: THE HAUNTED WORLD OF EDWARD D. WOOD, Jr. (1995
description: Description: Before Tim Burton and after Orson Welles. Not a biopic but an interesting biography-documentary on the master of low (budget), a Glen or Glenda matter. A fully loaded edition also. Tagline: Can your MIND stand the SHOCKING TRUTH? Plot: How was it possible that a movie like "Plan 9 from Outerspace" could be made? This documentary about Ed Wood Jr.'s masterpiece gives the answer. More info @: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0113270/reference http://www.dvddrive-in.com/reviews/e-h/hauntedworld.htm Format: DVD9 (Folder) Retail R1 America - Image Entertainment. Aspect Ratio: 1.33:1 Picture Format: Non-Anamorphic TV System: NTSC | Color/B&W | 112' + extras Soundtrack(s): English Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo Subtitles: None as released Not compressed, altered or censored at all. Commentaries: Audio commentary by director/co-producer/writer Brett Thompson, authors Kent Adamson and Charles Phoenix, associate producer Alan Doshna and the widow of late co-producer Crawford John Thomas, Pat Thomas. Extras: "Crossroads of Laredo (1948 )" - Ed Wood's first film, restored in 1995, with optional audio commentary (23:19) Footage from the official Ed Wood Reunion celebration at the 1996 Palm Springs Film Festival, with optional audio commentary (11:04) Footage from the Hollywood premiere, with optional audio commentary (6:16) Unedited interview with Brett Thompson and Mike Gabriel, shot and edited down for inclusion in the A&E Biography on Ed Wood (11:54) "Sci-Fi Buzz" - footage from the Sci-Fi Channel's news coverage of the world premiere (4:22) "Behind the Camera" - outtakes and behind the scenes footage (22:18 ) Photo Galleries: - Retro Galleries: -- Lillian's Photos (1:40) -- C.J.'s Albums (1:45) -- Haunted Hollywood (2:20) -- From the Desk of Ed Wood (0:55) - Film Galleries -- Color Gallery (5:45) -- B & W Gallery (4:40) -- Production Design Gallery (0:40) -- Design Studio (1:35) - Roadshow Galleries: -- Palm Springs Roadshow (2:30) -- Hollywood Premiere (2:00) "In Memoriam" (1:50) DVD Credits (1:35)
